result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian D. Hershey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences DEF to 20 years Prison 5 years initial confinement followed by 15 years on extended supervision  credit for one (1) day served report to jail 1-27-15  4:40 pm,  Court costs $113.00  conditions of extended supervision   Issue of counseling for children any counseling obtained by children to be submitted to DOC agent for  reasonable expenses incurred as restitution , Sexual Offender Treatment,   Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program, Comply with sex offender registry requirements,    No contact with victim(s) A, B C,  except unless they children want to have contact and involves treatment plan and is supervised.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.  Forward $1000.00 bond to DOC.

records.addlTxt: Zero
Sentencing Hearing January, 27, 2015

Defendant Christian D. Hershey in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI - a few clarifications noted.  State makes recommendation,  Rusk and Monroe counties have pending charges, but will not prosecute if joint recommendation of 20 years entered into.   Marvin Mullet makes statement;  Weldon Hershey makes statement;  Mr Troyer makes statement,  Mary Ann Swan makes argument.  Joint recommendation.  DEF makes statement.  
Court must consider seriousness of the crime, character of the defendant and protection of society.  Court feels DEF can rehabilitate himself with out incarceration,  Court sentences DEF to 20 years Prison 5 years initial confinement followed by 15 years on extended supervision  credit for one (1) day served report to jail 1-27-15  4:40 pm,  Court costs $113.00  conditions of extended supervision   Issue of counseling for children any counseling obtained by children to be submitted to DOC agent for  reasonable expenses incurred as restitution , Sexual Offender Treatment,   Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program, Comply with sex offender registry requirements,    No contact with victim(s) A, B C,  except unless they children want to have contact and involves treatment plan and is supervised.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.  Forward $1000.00 bond to DOC.
(Scanned & copies distributed.  mak)

No contact with Victim A, Victim B, or Victim C, or any juvenile under the age of 18 years of age.

EXCEPT:  DE may have written communication (writing letters and sending Christmas gifts) with Jerry Hershey and Weldon Hershey's children (i.e. his granchildren from those two sons only).  DE must tell parent what is in each gift to be opened at time of exchange.  

DE may have limited contact with Jerry and Weldon Hershey's children, provided during contact, one of those children's parents is also present and contact takes place in a public place.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Christian D. Hershey in court with Attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan. Prosecuting Atty Bruce Poquette appeared for State of Wisconsin.

State objects to DE's motion to allow contact with his grandchildren; does NOT want bond changed.  Scott Hershey (father of victim) wants no contact with his children.  Weldon Hershey (father of grandchildren of DE) feels ok to have supervised conditions for contact.  Gerry Hershey (father of DE's grandchildren) feels DE having contact with his children; none of his children were alleged victims.  DE has been having counseling and is asking for this change to allow restoration of family bonds.

No contact conditions of bond modified as follows: DE may have written communication (writing letters and sending Christmas gifts) with Gerry Hershey and Weldon Hershey's children (i.e. his granchildren).  DE must tell parent what is in each gift to be opened at time of exchange.  DE may have limited contact with Gerry and Weldon Hershey's children, provided during contact, one of those children's parents is also present and contact takes place in a public place.
Notice of Date for Motion to Modify Bail
Motion and Notice of Motion to Modify Bail
Sentencing hearing on January 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Christian D. Hershey in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads guilty to ct#1 found guilty, Cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Monroe and Rusk counties are not going to pursue charges in their counties.  Court  orders PSI  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christian D. Hershey in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information; advised of rights; Count 1, 2 & 3 enters plea of NG.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on September 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Confidential Witness List

Defendant Christian D. Hershey in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DE waived preliminary hearing.  State motions that the probable cause statement be sealed, and any documents with victims initials or name be sealed and victims be identified in future as Victim A, Victim B, and Victim C.  DE in agreement.  Court grants State's motion and seals the 5-2-14 bond and anything with victims' initials/names, including confidential witness list and any subsequent documents filed.  Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with Victim A, Victim B, or Victim C, or any juvenile under the age of 18 years of age.
No contact with Victim A, Victim B, or Victim C, or any juvenile under the age of 18 years of age.

Atty Mary Ann Swan for DEF

DEF appears in court.  District Atty Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.   The state is waiting on some reports, request adjournment.  Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for 7-01-14 at 8:30 am.
